description: Also known as Lilian's Lovebird, this is one of the smallest lovebird species. It has a green body and a beautiful orange-pink head and breast.
temperament: Known for being much quieter, sweeter, and more gentle than the other common lovebird species. They are less prone to aggression and nippiness.
loudness: Quiet. Their calls are softer and less frequent than those of Peach-faced or Fischer's, making them a much better choice for apartment living.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known to talk. Their vocalizations are a series of soft, pleasant chirps.
dietaryNeeds: A diet of small pellets, fresh greens, and vegetables is ideal. They can be more delicate, so a high-quality diet is crucial.
healthPointers: Can live 10-15 years. Can be more susceptible to stress and disease than hardier lovebird species. A clean, quiet, and stable environment is important.
housing: Excellent for apartments due to their quiet nature. A smaller cage is acceptable, but they are still active birds. Minimum 18"W x 18"D x 24"H.
